nucleus.manager

Class DefaultPresenterManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • nucleus.manager.PresenterManager
      • nucleus.manager.DefaultPresenterManager

  • public class DefaultPresenterManager
extends PresenterManager
    This is the default implementation of PresenterManager.

    • Method Detail

      • provide

        public <T extends Presenter> T provide(java.lang.Class<T> presenterClass,
                              android.os.Bundle savedState)
        Finds a Presenter for a given view or restores it from the saved state. There can be three cases when this method is being called: 1. First creation of a view; 2. Restoring of a view when the process has NOT been destroyed (configuration change, other activity recreation cases); 3. Restoring of a view when entire process has been destroyed.

        A presenter must have default constructor.

        Specified by:
        provide in class PresenterManager
        Returns:
        a found or created presenter.

      • save

        public android.os.Bundle save(Presenter presenter)
        Creates a bundle that can be used to re-instantiate a presenter. Pass this bundle to PresenterManager.provide(java.lang.Class<T>, android.os.Bundle).
        Specified by:
        save in class PresenterManager
        Parameters:
        presenter - a presenter to obtain restoration bundle for.
        Returns:
        a Bundle that can be used to re-instantiate a presenter.

      • destroy

        public void destroy(Presenter presenter)
        Destroys a presenter, removing all references to it.
        Specified by:
        destroy in class PresenterManager
        Parameters:
        presenter - a presenter to destroy.

      • print

        public void print(android.util.Printer printer)
        Prints a list of presenters and attached views.
        Specified by:
        print in class PresenterManager
        Parameters:
        printer - a target for printing.
